lol think it great gift along with the spa voucher thanks 99 sure that she will appreciate the gift and be happy but there the chance she could be offended which is why also adding the spa day it really great vacuum my mom has similar model and checked it out at her place it bag less and has hepa filter so many selling points this is the correct answer love new vacuum but would be super duper touched if hubby also included specific me gift spa voucher bracelet hair fork etc do know anything about giving gifts to ladies as am also poor at that but you should give peek through vacuumcleaners when choosing new vacuum the person who runs the sub is vacuum repair tech and could have some good insight into picking great vacuum that will keep your home nice and clean according to an ama recently bag less vacuums are not always better anyways good luck not stay at home mom but got dyson from my husband for christmas was thrilled love it so far got raised eyebrow from my parents when told them what he got me but do care it was perfect wanted it and had asked for replacement vaccuum for several months super happy with it even getting it as gift because it to me meant he listened and was trying to make me happy *nice* vacuum and be totally happy this is coming from the person who asked and recieved filing cabinet as gift one year and cried happy when my husband gave it to me have no qualms about useful gifts as long as they re at least pretty good quality and needed would say yes remember those vacuum ama though and the guy who repaired vacuums said that he did like dyson he liked miele best just something to consider looking into would be pretty happy with vacuum if had been saying wanted better one and it came with gift for spa day thanks not sure if bagless is always better but know that personally hate replacing the bag on my current vacuum it just gets dust everywhere and it gross have to clean it in the garden but the dyson that tried out at mom was painless to clean just dumped into the kitchen garbage can and away went also looked at miele but it looks much bulkier heavier my wife is quite petite and with self described spaghetti arms to be on the safe side would just casually bring in the vacuum and be like hey got new vacuum no biggie and then hit her with the spa day as the gift then you get double points you re sensitive that new vacuum is what the house needs so you re good partner and you re sensitive to what your wife needs spa day so you re good partner that my 2¢ yes you are getting her something she will use daily that makes her life easier but you are also pampering her this works on lot of levels me personally would want to pick out my own vacuum and would consider vacuum to be for the household not necessarily personal gift for me it would be much appreciated but not sure want to feel like *that* was my present the spa personal gift is great idea yes but not for her birthday vacuum is gift to the household not her think of vacuum in the same category as dishwasher and washing machine it insulting to insinuate that it gift for her because it not like it her sole responsibility sincerely hope that you do vacuum
